channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6176] Couple failures in SequenceGeneratorTest suite on trunk(1466748) with weme 6.2
item.description:
Failure on trunk(1466748) on windows machine with weme6.2

http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/main/windows/testlog/weme6.2/1466748-suites.All_diff.txt

1) test_16_6137(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.lang.SequenceTest)java.sql.SQLException: The exception 'java.lang.ClassCastException: java.math.BigDecimal incompatible with java.lang.Integer' was thrown while evaluating an expression.

item.summary: Couple failures in SequenceGeneratorTest suite on trunk(1466748) with weme 6.2

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Got error same error in 10.10 on weme:
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/v10_10/windows/testlog/weme6.2/1467157-suites.All_diff.txt

It looks like recent change to DERBY-6137 made changes to the
test_16_6137 test. Looks like the failure showed up in trunk when that
change was checked in, and then showed up in 10.10 branch when that
change was backported.

Probably change #1466623 is the cause.

test_16_6137 test is the regression test for derby-6137. Probably we should disable this test on weme and maybe all small devices. The disabling should be backported to 10.10. It shouldn't be necessary to backport the disabling to 10.9 even though the derby-6137 fix was backported to 10.9. That is because the test involves calling a system procedure added in 10.10 (SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_INVALIDATE_STORED_STATEMENTS); for that reason, the test_16_6137 regression test was not backported to 10.9. Thanks.
thanks rick, will look at disabling that test. there were some other failures in the SequencerGeneratorTest, also popped. Should we disable that one also?

Hi Mike,

I think that the other failures may be follow-on effects of the failure in test_16_6137. That test changes the default allocation count for sequences; if the test fails, then the default allocation count won't be reset. That might be what causes the other failures. Thanks.
I have disabled the test from small devices on trunk with revision 1467494. Will backport it to 10.10
Backported the disabling of test for small devices on 10.10 with revision 1467634
[bulk update] Close all resolved issues that haven't been updated for more than one year.
